channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: BPI Foundation, Ayala Land boost social enterprises
item.description: BPI Foundation, the social development arm of BPI, formalized on Thursday its partnership with Ayala Land Inc. (ALI) to further enhance its BPI Sinag program by providing market access for social enterprises.

item.title: July 20 a holiday for Eid’l Adha
item.author: Christina Mendez
item.description: President Duterte has declared Tuesday (July 20) a regular holiday in observance of the Eid’l Adha or the Feast of Sacrifice observed by the Muslim community.

item.title: ARTA seeks third party liability removal for vehicle registration
item.author: Louella Desiderio
item.description: The Anti-Red Tape Authority is pushing for the removal of the third party liability insurance as a requirement for vehicle registration for those already covered by a comprehensive automotive insurance policy, to simplify the process and ease the burden on the public.

item.title: 1.15 million AstraZeneca doses for private sector arrive today
item.author: Louella Desiderio
item.description: Presidential adviser for entrepreneurship and Go Negosyo founder Joey Concepcion, along with government officials, will welcome today the arrival of the first tranche of AstraZeneca vaccines procured by the private sector.

item.title: SC overturns decisions on Navy ensign’s death
item.author: Evelyn Macairan
item.description: The Supreme Court has overturned decisions of the Office of the Ombudsman and the Court of Appeals dismissing from the service eight Navy officers linked to the death of Ensign Philip Andrew Pestaño in 1995.

item.title: Isko: Not the right time to go around for alliances
item.author: Danilo Garcia
item.description: Without naming any particular politician or possible candidate, Manila Mayor Isko Moreno took a swipe yesterday at those making the rounds to forge political alliances and partnerships for the May 2022 polls amid the pandemic.

item.title: ‘Duterte recognizes PDP-Laban belongs to Pimentels’
item.author: Christina Mendez
item.description: President Duterte recognizes that the Pimentels virtually own the PDP-Laban, which is now divided over the issue on who should be its standard bearer in next year’s general elections, presidential spokesman Harry Roque Jr. said yesterday.

item.title: PNP probes sale of fake COVID-19 test results
item.author: Emmanuel Tupas
item.description: Top investigators of the Philippine National Police have been assigned to expose and arrest the people behind the alleged sale of falsified negative COVID-19 test results.

item.title: IATF may increase business capacity with more vaccinations
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: The government’s pandemic task force is ready to consider the proposal to increase the allowed capacity for workplaces once 80 percent of employees are vaccinated for COVID-19, Malacañang said yesterday.

item.title: Philippines mulls adding Malaysia, Thailand to travel ban
item.author: Mayen Jaymalin
item.description: The government is looking to impose travel restrictions on two more Asian countries facing a surge in cases of the COVID-19 Delta variant.
